definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to scratch/to mess about with/to quarrel/to scramble to do/sb or sth that one can rely on
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
iron hook at the end a long pole
variant of 干擾|干扰[gan1 rao3], to interfere
split due to repeated folding/flex crack

sentences.english: Then I'll transition to a head scratching.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我就会开始挠挠她的头。

sentences.english: Then I'll transition to a head scratching.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我就会开始挠挠她的头。

sentences.english: The messenger bent and scratched at his knee where the strapping chafed.
sentences.chinese: 送信人弯下腰来，挠着膝部被绑腿磨红的地方。

sentences.english: The culture of NaoYang wrestle is a kind of human legacy with an active culture.
sentences.chinese: 挠羊摔跤文化是一种活态体育人文遗产。

sentences.english: But the question is an itch that certainly needs a scratch.
sentences.chinese: 但这个问题就像皮肤瘙痒需要挠挠一样。

sentences.english: But the question is an itch that certainly needs a scratch.
sentences.chinese: 但这个问题就像皮肤瘙痒需要挠挠一样。

sentences.english: Gerhardt ran his hand through his reddish brown hair distractedly .
sentences.chinese: 葛哈德只是发狂似地拿手挠他那红褐色的头发。

sentences.english: You deserve to get scratched. What should we call that?
sentences.chinese: 你应该被挠，我们应该叫它什么？

sentences.english: Brown Ben scratched at his speckled grey-and-white whiskers.
sentences.chinese: 棕色的本挠了挠他斑灰白斑驳的胡须。

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his chin.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打个哈欠，挠挠下巴。

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his chin.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打个哈欠，挠挠下巴。

sentences.english: Obviously like something happened and she scratched you.
sentences.chinese: 很闲人就像有些事发生了，她挠了你。

sentences.english: You can do this by poking her or running your fingers on her ticklish spots and gently teasing her.
sentences.chinese: 戳他或者是用手指挠他痒痒然后轻轻地逗她。

sentences.english: Beautiful. This is really scratching my rash.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮，这东西挠我的疹子挠的好舒服。

sentences.english: Beautiful. This is really scratching my rash.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮，这东西挠我的疹子挠的好舒服。

definition: to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
